comments: Start with 3; other terms are formed from pairs of successive digits in decimal expansion of Pi.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..10000
mathematica: Module[{A037244 = {}, p = N[Pi, 139]}, Do[Module[{temp = IntegerPart[p]}, AppendTo[A037244, temp];   p = 100 (p - temp);], {70}]; A037244]
author: Chung Wa, Ho (chungwa(AT)netvigator.com)
extensions: Better definition from _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 10 2006
